newsitem.title: USA: Netcom sees operating profit in Q4.
newsitem.headline: Netcom sees operating profit in Q4.

text.p: Netcom On-Line Communication Services Inc said it expects to report in the fourth quarter an unspecified profit before deducting interest expense, taxes and depreciation.
The Internet access provider also said it expects to report a negative cash flow of about $20 million, which is better than Wall Street analysts expected.

Netcom, based in San Jose, Calif., said it is improving its financial performance by spending less money on finding new customers, eliminating some pricing promotions and focusing its marketing on business users.
The company said it will phase out its $19.95-a-month pricing option, but did not specify with what option it will replace it.
Most consumer-oriented Internet access providers offer unlimited access to the global network for $19.95 a month -- a price that leaves little room for profits, analysts have said.

Netcom also said it expects to gain 20,000 to 30,000 new paying customers in the fourth quarter, bringing its total to about 580,000. Company officials could not immediately be reached for more comment.
